meanings.definition: A person who stifles or suppresses something.
meanings.sent1: The stifler in the meeting always silenced any new ideas.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the office stifler, never allowing any fun activities.
meanings.sent3: The stifler at the party made sure no one danced or laughed too loudly.
meanings.sent4: He acted like a stifler of joy, always putting a damper on celebrations.
meanings.sent5: The stifler of creativity in the group made it hard for anyone to express new thoughts.

meanings.definition: To suppress or hold back something, such as a cough or a laugh.
meanings.sent1: Please stifler your laughter during the serious presentation.
meanings.sent2: He tried to stifler his cough during the quiet moment in the play.
meanings.sent3: She had to stifler her sneeze during the silent meditation session.
meanings.sent4: The audience tried to stifler their gasps at the unexpected twist.
meanings.sent5: He couldn't stifler his excitement when he saw the surprise gift.
